Package org.apache.logging.log4j.spi

Class AbstractScopedContextProvider

java.lang.Object
org.apache.logging.log4j.spi.AbstractScopedContextProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
ScopedContextProvider
public abstract class AbstractScopedContextProvider extends Object implements ScopedContextProvider
An implementation of ScopedContextProvider that uses the simplest implementation.
Since:
2.24.0

    • newScopedContext

      public ScopedContext.Instance newScopedContext(String key, Object value)
      Creates a ScopedContext Instance with a key/value pair.
      Specified by:
      newScopedContext in interface ScopedContextProvider
      Parameters:
      key - the key to add.
      value - the value associated with the key.
      Returns:
      the Instance constructed if a valid key and value were provided. Otherwise, either the current Instance is returned or a new Instance is created if there is no current Instance.

    • newScopedContext

      public ScopedContext.Instance newScopedContext(Map<String,?> map)
      Creates a ScopedContext Instance with a Map of keys and values.
      Specified by:
      newScopedContext in interface ScopedContextProvider
      Parameters:
      map - the Map.
      Returns:
      the ScopedContext Instance constructed.

    • newScopedContext

      public ScopedContext.Instance newScopedContext(boolean withThreadContext)
      Creates a ScopedContext Instance that indicates the ThreadContext should be included.
      Specified by:
      newScopedContext in interface ScopedContextProvider
      Parameters:
      withThreadContext - true if the ThreadContext should be included.
      Returns:
      the ScopedContext Instance constructed.
